channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: The Films and Shows You Should Be Streaming in March 2026
item.description: We've picked out the best horror, sci-fi, and genre titles coming to Netflix, Hulu, Disney+, and beyond.

item.title: AMD and Meta reveal massive GPU deployment news — 6GW of Instinct hardware set to massively boost Facebook owner's computing stack
item.description: AMD and Meta agree to deploy up to six gigawatts of Instinct GPUs, expanding AI infrastructure through multi-year hardware and equity alignment.

item.title: Interview : ce que le télescope James-Webb a vraiment révélé sur Uranus et ce qu'il laisse sans réponse
item.description: Pour compléter notre article récemment publié sur les nouvelles découvertes concernant l’atmosphère d’Uranus, nous avons eu l’opportunité d’interviewer Paola Tiranti, auteure de l’étude. Ses travaux apportent un éclairage sans précédent sur l'atmosphère de cette géante glacée, en explorant des...

item.title: The PS5 Pro is getting upgraded upscaling tech in March
item.description: After suggesting a version of AMD's FSR 4 could be ported to the PS5 Pro last year, it looks like Sony is finally rolling out an update with the upscaling tech in March. Mark Cerny, the lead architect of the PS4, PS5 and PS5 Pro, shared via a blog post that the PS5 Pro will be updated with a new version of the company's PSSR (PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution) upscaling tech next month, and Resident Evil Requiem is one of the first games to use it.PSSR is "an AI library that analyzes game images pixel by pixel as it upscales them," Cerny says, which boosts the visual fidelity of games on t...

item.title: I Never Would’ve Guessed the Skynet Problem Would Come Before the Mass Layoffs
item.description: You don't need to worry about AI taking your job during a nuclear apocalypse.

item.title: 'So big, it's basically a Start screen again': Windows 11's new Start menu is getting some hate — and triggering Windows 8 flashbacks
item.description: Windows 11's new Start menu is proving seriously divisive – some feel it's huge and badly designed, but there are fans too.

item.title: Google and OpenAI employees sign open letter in ‘solidarity’ with Anthropic
item.description: Hundreds of employees at Google and OpenAI have signed an open letter urging their companies to stand with Anthropic in its standoff with the Pentagon over military applications for AI tools like Claude. The letter, titled “We Will Not Be Divided,” calls on the leadership of both companies to “put aside their differences and stand together to continue to refuse the Department of War’s current demands for permission to use our models for domestic mass surveillance and autonomously killing people without human oversight.” These are two lines that Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has said should not be...

item.title: Sam Altman Insists He Also Has Principles as Anthropic’s Pentagon Stand Off Continues
item.description: Bravely taking a position that won't get tested.

item.title: Musk bashes OpenAI in deposition, saying ‘nobody committed suicide because of Grok’
item.description: In his lawsuit against OpenAI, Musk touted xAI safety compared with ChatGPT. A few months later, xAI's Grok flooded X with nonconsensual nude images.

item.title: What's an E-Bike? California Wants You to Know
item.description: Cities want to stop kids from getting hurt. A lawmaker thinks warning them away from legal gray-area “e-motos” could help.

item.title: California to Paramount: Assimilate This
item.description: After Netflix dropped out of the race to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery, Paramount is poised for victory—but it's not there yet.

item.title: The Trump phone sure looks a lot like this HTC handset
item.description: Where's the Trump phone? We're going to keep talking about it every week. We've reached out, as usual, to ask about the Trump phone's whereabouts, and have stopped getting a response. This week, thanks to a reader tip, we think we've found the original phone the T1 is based on. A long time ago, back […]

item.title: NASA no longer plans to land on the moon in the next Artemis mission
item.description: NASA won't go to the moon in the next Artemis mission, forgoing the opportunity in exchange with a plan to speed up the launch rate.

item.title: Anthropic vs. the Pentagon: What’s actually at stake?
item.description: Anthropic and the Pentagon are clashing over AI use in autonomous weapons and surveillance, raising high-stakes questions about national security, corporate control, and who sets the rules for military AI.

item.title: OpenAI Fires an Employee for Prediction Market Insider Trading
item.description: Prediction markets like Polymarket and Kalshi are big business, and some Big Tech employees are testing boundaries by making trades based on insider knowledge.

item.title: CISA is getting a new acting director after less than a year
item.description: The US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), which is part of the Department of Homeland Security, is getting a new acting director, as reported by ABC, less than a year after Madhu Gottumukkala took charge of the agency as deputy director and acting director in May 2025. CISA's executive assistant director for cybersecurity, Nick […]...

item.title: TCL releases RayNeo Air 4 Pro AR smart glasses for only $299: Save $50 at launch
item.description: TCL's RayNeo Air 4 Pro smart glasses are a "head-mounted TV" with vibrant, HDR-capable OLED displays. Grab these new smart glasses with a $50 discount.

item.title: Everything Larry and David Ellison Will Control If Paramount Buys Warner Bros.
item.description: Paramount Skydance’s sprawling media empire will get a major boost if the deal is approved.

item.title: Enterprise MCP adoption is outpacing security controls
item.description:
AI agents now carry more access and more connections to enterprise systems than any other software in the environment. That makes them a bigger attack surface than anything security teams have had to govern before, and the industry doesn't yet have a framework for it. "If that attack vector gets utilized, it can result in a data breach, or even worse," said Spiros Xanthos, founder and CEO of Resolve AI, speaking at a recent VentureBeat AI Impact Series event.
Traditional security frameworks are built around human interactions. There's not yet an agreed-upon construct for AI agents that have p...

item.title: ‘French Sunday’ is the latest viral happiness trend. Here’s how to do it the right way—and boost your productivity all week
item.description: If you’re looking for more work-life balance, take a lesson from Paris. If you think Paris is always a good idea and the French do everything better, especially leisure—then this one is for you.

item.title: AI deepfakes are a train wreck and Samsung’s selling tickets
item.description: On Thursday morning, I attended a Q&A panel with four top Samsung smartphone executives. Until 2025, Samsung was the world's largest smartphone manufacturer, and by association, the world's largest maker of cameras. It's still the second largest after Apple. Samsung handed me the microphone first. I asked: We see a divide in society between people […]...

item.title: 11 things to expect at MWC 2026 — from the Nothing Phone 4a to Honor's humanoid robot
item.description: MWC 2026 is kicking off soon, and we have a good idea of what to expect at this tech-packed event.

item.title: FedEx will refund customers for Trump’s tariffs — if there ever are any refunds
item.description: FedEx plans to pass along any refunds resulting from the Supreme Court's ruling that some of President Donald Trump's tariffs are "illegal." In a statement on its website, FedEx notes that while "no refund process has been established by the courts," the company will reimburse shippers and consumers impacted by tariffs if it gets its […]

item.title: Pour moins de 140 euros, cet écran Lenovo optimisé pour le gaming (144 Hz, 1 ms) est une super affaire
item.description: Avec cette remise qui le fait tomber à 139,90 euros, cet écran gaming de Lenovo est très intéressant. Il pourra vous offrir de superbes performances à l'image de son taux de rafraîchissement de 144 Hz pour des sessions de jeu très plaisantes.
